intro: Scorzoneroides keretina, commonly known as the rock rose. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its stems are woody and often branched. Scorzoneroides keretina is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
